content.description: Saunter up the ramp finding the undercling and then lift off!
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter.
content.location: This boulder is just below a 3-4ft drop in the granite hillside and is overlooked by a MASSIVE boulder near the top of the bald rock dome.

climbs.name: Potato
climbs.fa: Open Project. V6-?? Don't know if it's really hard or just not for me.

content.description: Climb directly up the center of the overhanging face of the boulder starting on a lefthand crimp and roghthand slopey-jug, cranking through bad crimps and pinches reach the lip for an easy mantel.
content.location: Left of Chip (V3). ~250m east of the Stuntin' is a Habit boulder.

content.description: Crack begins as borderline offwidth and narrows to being too small even for fingers just before the top. Here you must use two good crimps, the higher of which is a sidepull to crank to the lip and mantle.
content.protection: 2 pads. Maybe a spotter, there is a boulder just behind that could be problematic if the climber fell too far back.
content.location: Take the main path in heading straight back until you crest the first ridge of bald rock, and are looking down at a shallow ravine and more expose granite below you, the bunny blocks and asteroids should be visible ahead and to the right from this position. From here, take a sharp left heading towards the tallest point of bald rock. The back of the boulder will be visible on your left as you near the the big tall dome and the very large boulders around it. Levels are deceptive here so the boulder may look about 3ft tall from the backside but if you scramble down around thats where the line is.

content.description: Start as far low and right as possible climbing the arete/lip for a straightforward mantel near the middle of the boulder.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter.
content.location: About 200- 300m east of the Leap of Snape boulder. Boulder is distinct in the large collection of huge huecos on its side for such a small lowball.
